public class DBManager
extends Object

Title: DBManager

Description: This class manages the DataBase connection and transactions

Author:
Mark Kornfilt

sharedInstance

public static DBManager sharedInstance()
This creates the only instance of this class. This differs from the C++ standard implementation by Gamma et.al. since Java ensures the order of static initialization at runtime.

Returns:
the shared instance of this class.
See Also:
Lazy instantiation - Balancing performance and resource usage

escapeSQL

public static String escapeSQL(String sql)
Filter the SQL string of Java SQL Escape clauses. Currently implemented Escape clauses are those mentioned in 11.3 in the specification. Basically we look through the sql string for {d xxx}, {t xxx} or {ts xxx} in non-string sql code. When we find them, we just strip the escape part leaving only the xxx part. So, something like "select * from x where d={d '2001-10-09'}" would return "select * from x where d= '2001-10-09'".

Parameters:
sql -

preprocessSQL

public String preprocessSQL(String sql)
